headline: Owls Take Second at Mercer Invitational
content: FORSYTH, Ga. ‚Äì Florida Atlantic women's golf (+44) finished second at Monday's Mercer Invitational. The tournament hosts, Mercer, won the team title at +19. This was the final event of the fall for the Owls.Quick HitsThe Owls were led individually by Nancy Cox (+8) in fifth place.Cox finished five behind Mercer's Katie Scheck and added another Top 15 finish after a T14 and a T3 in her previous two starts this fall.Tina Genoulaz and Charlotte Perkins each tied for seventh.Giulia Scarcello finished 25th while Maddie Rathjen was 37th.What's NextThe Owls return to tournament action in February when they host the Paradise Invitational sponsored by CIEE Golf is Global.Owls on Social MediaFor complete coverage of FAU women's golf, follow us on X and Instagram (@FAUWGolf).

headline: Florida Atlantic Sweeps Tulsa
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì The Florida Atlantic volleyball team bounced back in a big way on Sunday, earning a straight-set sweep over the Tulsa Golden Hurricane, 3-0 (25-23, 25-18, 25-17) on Sunday afternoon inside Eleanor R. Baldwin Arena. HOW IT HAPPENED Tulsa took an early 8-5 lead to open the match, forcing an early FAU timeout. Following a 14-10 Tulsa advantage, Anna Hartman scored three-straight kills for FAU, battling the Owls back within one at 14-13. Back-to-back Golden Hurricane errors evened the match at 15 apiece. Following a 21-19 Tulsa advantage, the Owls went on a 5-1 run to force a pair of Golden Hurricane timeouts, holding set point at 24-22. Tulsa got one back, but a service error closed out the first set, giving the Owls the 25-23 win. Tulsa opened the second set with a 13-9 lead, forcing an early Owl timeout. Trailing by four at 17-13, the Owls locked in and dominated the remainder of the set. Five straight Tulsa errors sparked a 12-1 FAU run to close the second set as the Owls claimed the 25-18 win to take a two-set advantage, 2-0. After battling through a 7-7 tie to open the third, the Owls produced a 7-1 run to take a six-point lead and force nearly back-to-back timeouts from the Golden Hurricane, leading 14-8. The Owls extended their lead to nine, following a pair of kills from Libby Ashline and a pair of Tulsa errors, 22-13. The Golden Hurricane cut the deficit to six, 23-17, but another Golden Hurricane error and a kill from Hartman clinched the straight-set sweep for the Owls, 25-17. STATS & NOTES Hartman led the way for the Owls, recording a match-leading 12 kills, hitting an impressive .571, while Kierstin Bevelle, Kayla Richardson, and Ashline followed just behind, tying for second on the team with eight kills each. Emsley Venard dished out a team-best 22 assists against the Golden Hurricane. Defensively, Isabelle Northam led the Owls' back row, tying for a match-best 12 digs, while Libby Ashline led the Owls at the net, posting a team-best six blocks in the win. As a team, the Owls dominated the Golden Hurricane on the block, 10 to four, in addition to holding advantages in kills (46), hitting percentage (.346), assists (43), and digs (43). The win ties the all-time series between Florida Atlantic and Tulsa, 2-2. UP NEXT The Owls will head out on their final regular-season road trip next weekend as they visit Tulane on Friday, Nov. 7, before facing Rice in their road finale on Sunday, Nov. 9. FOLLOW THE OWLS To stay up to date with everything Florida Atlantic volleyball, follow @FAUVolleyball on X and Instagram, or like FAU Volleyball on Facebook.

headline: Owls Tie Tulsa, Earn Share of Conference Regular Season Title
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Florida Atlantic men's soccer (10-3-2, 5-1-2) tied Tulsa (4-8-4, 3-3-2) 0-0 on Sunday. With Charlotte tying Missouri State, the Owls and the 49ers share the title of Regular Season Champions of the American Conference. It's the third regular season conference title in program history and the first since 2007. Florida Atlantic entered the night needing to match Charlotte's result against Missouri State or better it to become the outright champions. The Owls launched 19 shot attempts at the Tulsa goal but could not find a breakthrough. On the other end, goalkeeper Guilherme Pipolo made three saves to record his first solo clean sheet. The Owls will be the number two seed and receive a first-round bye in the American Conference Tournament. They will meet the winner of USF and Tulsa in the semifinals on Wednesday, November 12, at 3:30 p.m. The semis and the championship will both be hosted in Charlotte, North Carolina. To view the full bracket, visit https://theamerican.org/news/2025/11/3/field-set-for-2025-american-conference-mens-soccer-championship.aspx. Head coach Joey Worthen Postgame with @joeyworthen #WIPüèùÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/t2H1fYdef3 ‚Äî Florida Atlantic Men's Soccer (@FAUMSoccer) November 3, 2025 FOLLOW US For complete coverage of FAU men's soccer, follow us on X and Instagram (@FAUMSoccer).

headline: Owls Open Season With Overtime Victory Over Boston College
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Late game heroics from freshman Yohann Sissoko lifted the Florida Atlantic men's basketball team past Boston College in an 83-78 overtime win at Eleanor R. Baldwin Arena on Monday night. The Owls (1-0) battled back from a late second half deficit versus the Eagles (0-1) to tie the game and missed just one shot in the extra five minutes to start the season with a victory, their first over a power conference team at home since December of 2002 against Miami. FIRST HALF A nearly full court pass to a wide-open redshirt sophomore guard Devin Vanterpool for the slam dunk opened the Owls' scoring. A 12-3 Owls run, highlighted by nine points from junior Xander Pintelon, gave FAU a nine-point lead. A three-pointer by redshirt sophomore forward Devin Williams put Florida Atlantic up by 10 for the first time of the night. Boston College closed the deficit to one, but junior guard Kanaan Carlyle hit a late three-pointer to give the Owls a 35-31 advantage entering halftime. SECOND HALF Six straight points from Isaiah Elohim built Florida Atlantic's lead, with the redshirt sophomore guard putting together a highlight reel sequence of plays featuring a driving slam dunk followed by an acrobatic and-one. The Eagles tied the game with 10 minutes remaining and soon took a six-point lead off the 8-0 run. Boston College was up by nine with under five minutes left, but the lead was cut to three in less than a minute with back-to-back three pointers from Sissoko and Carlyle. Down by five with 46 seconds to play, the Owls forced a turnover to get the ball back, with Carlyle drawing the foul and sinking two free throws to cut the score to 66-63. The Eagles did not have an opportunity to close out the game, with Sissoko intercepting a pass and drilling a shot from beyond the arc to tie the score at 66 apiece with 31 seconds on the clock. Neither team scored again, sending the game into overtime. OVERTIME The duo of Carlyle and Sissoko came up clutch once again, with the former sinking a three to tie it at 78-78 and a driving layup from Sissoko to take a lead that the Owls did not relinquish. A three-pointer from Pintelon with just over a minute to go put Florida Atlantic up by six, sealing the victory. PRESS CONFERENCES GALLERY Gallery: (11-3-2025) MBB vs. Boston College STATS & NOTES The Owls last played an overtime game at the Elly in February of 2023, also an FAU victory. Among the five players with double digit scoring, Carlyle finished with 19 points to lead the team. Vanterpool nabbed a career high eight rebounds, seven coming in the first half. He also dished out a career best six assists to lead the Owls. Sissoko finished with 15 points in his collegiate debut, finishing a perfect three-for-three from beyond the arc. Pintelon recorded three blocks. As a team, the Owls shot 52% (12-for-23) from three-point range. UP NEXT Florida Atlantic will travel to Lynchburg, Virginia, for the third edition of the Field of 68 Classic on Saturday, Nov. 8, against Charleston and Sunday, Nov. 9, versus host Liberty. Both games tip off at 6 p.m. on YouTube. FOLLOW THE OWLS To stay up to date on all things FAU men's basketball, follow the Owls on social media @FAUMBB. Florida Atlantic's 2025-26 season is sponsored by Phil Smith Kia/Phil Smith Acura.

headline: Freeland Era Begins with a Win Over Florida Memorial
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Head Coach LeAnn Freeland secured her first win in Paradise on Tuesday night when the Florida Atlantic Owls earned a season-opening 89-46 win over the Florida Memorial Lions inside Eleanor R. Baldwin Arena. HOW IT HAPPENED The Owls started slow, trailing Florida Memorial 14-8 through the game's 3:59-minute mark. However, Grace Carstensen's first 3-pointer of the day sparked a 13-4 FAU run, giving the Owls the 21-18 first-quarter lead. Florida Atlantic carried the momentum into the second, opening the period on a 12-2 run, capped off by back-to-back triples from Michiyah Simmons to extend the Owls' lead to double digits at 33-20, at the second-quarter media break. The Owls matched the Lions over the remainder of the half, holding onto their 13-point advantage through the halftime break, 41-28. FAU opened the third quarter with a 9-4 run to extend the lead to 18 at 50-32, following Carstensen's third 3-pointer of the day. Florida Memorial tried to chip away at the Owls' lead, cutting the deficit back to 13, 54-31, at the third quarter three-minute mark, but the Owls answered with 13 unanswered points, highlighted by eight from Carstensen, to close out the third quarter and take a 26-point lead into the fourth at 67-41. Florida Atlantic sealed the game in the fourth, outscoring the Lions 22-5 over the final 10 minutes of play for the 89-46 season-opening win. HEAR FROM HEAD COACH LEANN FREELAND "I'm really proud of our players. I thought they did a really great job playing together on both ends of the court and making the adjustments we needed to pull off the win against a really talented Florida Memorial team. They are a scrappy team. They know how to win, and they were not going away. I thought we had to play a good game to beat them tonight." NOTES AND TEAM STATS The victory marked the first Freeland win as Florida Atlantic's Head Coach. Vivian Onugha and Carstensen led the way for the Owls. Onugha tallied her first NCAA double-double, with a game-leading career-best 24 points and finishing second on the team with 11 boards. She shot 80 percent (8-of-10) from the field and added eight free throws. Carstensen also produced a new career-high, scoring 21 points, shooting 64 percent (7-of-11) from the floor, 67 percent (4-of-6) from beyond the arc, and was perfect at the line (3-of-3). Haley Walker led the Owls on the glass, collecting a team-leading 14 boards. Zahira Arizmendi and Ineivi Plata tied for a team-leading five assists on the night. As a team, the Owls dominated in nearly every statistical category. FAU shot 55.4 percent from the field, 50 percent from beyond the arc, and 69.6 percent at the line. FAU also dominated the Lions on the boards, outrebounding FMU 45-17, doubling up the Lions on the defensive glass, 31-15. The Owls also outpaced the Lions in points in the paint, 40 to 28, points off turnovers, 24 to 14, second chance points, 14 to 0, fast break points, 29 to 4, and points off the bench, 48 to 13. UP NEXT The Owls now kick off a three-game road trip, beginning with Kennesaw State on Saturday, Nov. 8, at 7 p.m. inside the KSU Convocation Center and on ESPN+. FOLLOW THE OWLS For updates, follow @FAUWBB_Hoops on X and @FAUWBB on Instagram, or like Florida Atlantic Women's Basketball on Facebook.

headline: Coach Jakus Meets with Media on Wednesday
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Florida Atlantic men's basketball Head Coach John Jakus met with the media on opening the season 1-0 at home and traveling to play in the Field of 68 Tipoff this weekend. Jakus spoke about the Owls' kicking off the season with an electric overtime win over Boston College in the Elly on Monday, Nov. 3. Florida Atlantic will travel to Lynchburg, Va., to compete in the third anf final year of the Field of 68, hosted by Liberty. FAU will face Charleston on Saturday, Nov. 8, with tipoff set for 6 p.m. on YouTube. The Owls will close out the round robin with Liberty on Sunday, Nov. 9, at 6 p.m. FOLLOW THE OWLS To stay up to date on all things FAU men's basketball, follow the Owls on social media @FAUMBB. Florida Atlantic's 2025-26 season is sponsored by Phil Smith Kia/Phil Smith Acura.

headline: Owls Prepare for Tussle with Tulsa
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì The Florida Atlantic football team is heavy into game planning for a 3 p.m. homecoming game versus Tulsa scheduled for this Saturday, Nov. 8 at Flagler Credit Union Stadium. Entering the weekend, the Owls hold an all-time record of 3-1 versus the Golden Hurricane, including a 63-16 victory a year ago in Tulsa. FAU, which will continue its 25th Anniversary celebration by welcoming back all former student-athletes, including more than 1,000 who have played Owl football, is 2-0 versus Tulsa in Paradise. The team will wear helmets decaled with the original team logo. A mini helmet version is available through the University bookstore or on line, click HERE. NOTABLE Starting Fast - Hagerty Family Football Head Coach Zach Kittley's Air Raid offense is aggressive early and often, which has paid off tremendously. The Owls have scored on their opening possession in five consecutive games, never done before in program history. In the month of October, the offense converted 18 out of 20 (90%) fourth down attempts. Top of the Nation - Redshirt junior QB Caden Veltkamp leads the nation in completions per game (28.1) and third nationally in passing offense (325.4), His connection with redshirt junior WR Easton Messer, who arrived with Veltkamp in January from their previous school, has continued to flourish with the wideout at the top of the NCAA in receptions per game (8.5). Elite Company - Redshirt junior LB Tyler Stolsky has racked up tackles at a high rate, notching 12+ in three straight games. The last Owl to do so was Azeez Al-Shaair back in 2017. Stolsky holds the team lead at 60 on the season. All-Around Platt - Redshirt junior WR Jayshon Platt has contributed to Florida Atlantic via receiving (471 yards, three touchdowns), rushing (12 yards per-carry, one touchdown), and kick returning (498 yards), to rank 11th nationwide in all-purpose yards per game at 125.6 and 13th in total (1,005). This week's game, sponsored by Ideal Nutrition, is also Veteran Appreciation and Varsity Owl weekend. PURCHASE 25TH ANNIVERSARY MERCH HERE Click HERE MINI HELMETS Click HERE CELEBRATING 25 YEARS Click HERE for 25 Years Celebration Content. COMPLETE 2025 SCHEDULE Click HERE. GROUPS OF ALL AGES To purchase group tickets, click HERE. FOLLOW THE TEAM Stay informed by reading FAUSports.com or through football's Twitter and Instagram accounts @FAUFootball.

headline: Florida Atlantic Coaches Show Presented by Duffy‚Äôs
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Florida Atlantic's Coaches Show, presented by Duffy's Sports Grill, returns Thursday, Nov. 6 at Duffy's Sports Grill of Boca Raton, located at 21212 St. Andrews Boulevard in Boca Raton. The show will air from 6-7 p.m. on Fox Sports 640 South Florida. Hagerty Family Head Football Coach Zach Kittley is the featured guest throughout the fall along with host and voice of the Owls Ken LaVicka. This week, football's Chief of Staff Harrison Hanna will also join the show as will Head Women's Basketball Coach LeAnn Freeland. Join Kittley, LaVicka, Hanna and Freeland in review of all things FAU Athletics as well as a preview of the Saturday, Nov. 8 game versus Tulsa, a fellow American Conference member, as well as Homecoming festivities. As part of Homecoming, all Varsity Owl student-athletes are invited back to campus, while the football team's celebration of 25 years of play continues by recognizing former players on the field. Coach Freeland opens her first year at the helm of the Owls on Tuesday night in the Eleanor R. Baldwin Arena. Freeland will next lead the women's basketball team on the road versus Kennesaw State on Saturday, Nov. 8 at 7 p.m. To follow the games: football is scheduled for 3 p.m. at Flagler Credit Union Stadium. Women's basketball will tip at 7 p.m. Both are carried on ESPN+. Football also will air on Fox Sports 640 AM South Florida. Come enjoy the Coaches Show while taking advantage of Duffy's famous 2-for-1 drinks, available all day, everyday specials. The show also airs live each week on the flagship station of the Florida Atlantic Sports Network, FOX Sports 640 South Florida and the FOX Sports 640 app. CELEBRATING 25 YEARS Click HERE for 25 Years Celebration Content. COMPLETE 2025 SCHEDULE Click HERE. GROUPS OF ALL AGES To purchase group tickets, click HERE. TAILGATE INFORMATION Florida Atlantic Alumni & Community Engagement is hosting tailgates for the South Florida, and Navy road games. All home game tailgates will be at the Marleen and Harold Forkas Alumni Center. For more information on these opportunities, email carlsone@fau.edu. FOLLOW THE TEAM Stay informed by reading FAUSports.com or through football's Twitter and Instagram accounts @FAUFootball.

headline: Out of the Bye Week and Into Homecoming
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì With the bye week in the rearview mirror, the Florida Atlantic football team returned to the practice fields on Tuesday in preparation for the final stretch of the 2025 season. An opportunity awaits the Owls in their matchup against Tulsa on Saturday, Nov. 8 at Flagler Credit Union Stadium, where three of the team's final four games of the year will be held. In recognition of Homecoming and Varsity Owls Weekend as well as the ongoing celebration of the 25th anniversary of the program, FAU will don a throwback look. Saturday's kick is scheduled for 3 p.m. on ESPN+. ESPN+ PRESSER Click HERE to watch Hagerty Family Head Football Coach Zach Kittley's weekly press conference, joined by redshirt juniors QB Caden Veltkamp and DL CJ Doggette Jr. PURCHASE 25TH ANNIVERSARY MERCH HERE Click HERE. MINI HELMETS Click HERE. CELEBRATING 25 YEARS Click HERE for 25 Years Celebration Content. COMPLETE 2025 SCHEDULE Click HERE. GROUPS OF ALL AGES To purchase group tickets, click HERE. FOLLOW THE TEAM Stay informed by reading FAUSports.com or through football's Twitter and Instagram accounts @FAUFootball.

headline: Owls Open Season Tuesday vs. Florida Memorial
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Florida Atlantic women's basketball will tip off the 2025-26 season on Tuesday, hosting the Florida Memorial Lions for a 7 p.m. tip off inside Eleanor R. Baldwin Arena on ESPN+. The Owls' season opener is sponsored by Flagler Credit Union. Fans in attendance will receive a free rally towel. A LOOK AT THE OWLS Florida Atlantic enters its inaugural season under Head Coach LeAnn Freeland. Freeland brings a winning culture to Boca Raton, boasting a 363-159 career record over her 17 seasons as a head coach, including six conference championships, 11 NCAA Tournament appearances, four Elite Eight appearances, and one Final Four appearance. The Owls' return Ta'Ziah Jenks, Erin Rodgers, and Zahira Arizmendi from last year's squad. Rodgers highlights the Owls' returners, who led the team last season in rebounding per contest, averaging 5.6 rebounds per game, and finished second on the team in scoring average, recording 12 points per game during the 2024-25 campaign. Jenks ranked third on the team last season in rebounding, averaging 5.3 rebounds per game. She is also the Owls' returning leader in steals and assists, averaging 1.2 steals and 1.0 assists per game last season. The Owls also welcome eight newcomers, including Destyne Jackson, Grace Carstensen, Jess Moors, Michiyah Simmons, Ineivi Plata, Haley Walker, Madi Gewirtz, and Vivian Onugha. SCOUTING FLORIDA MEMORIAL Florida Memorial enters Tuesday's contest at 1-0 overall after opening their season with a 74-47 win against the University of Fort Lauderdale. Last season, the Lions finished with a 24-5 overall record and a 13-3 mark in Sun Conference play. FMU earned its first-ever NAIA Tournament win, defeating Indiana Northwest 85-76 in the opening round, before concluding its season with a 68-47 loss against Freed-Hardeman in the second round. The Lions are in their second season under head coach Kevin Herod. FMU returns two from its 2024-25 squad in Alicia Bates and Kalea Rainey and welcomes nine newcomers. Rainey and Sa'mya Stevens lead the Lions, tying for a team-best 15 points in their season opener. Stevens also leads the Lions in assists, dishing out a team-best seven against Fort Lauderdale. Jazlynn Givens leads FMU in rebounding, collecting seven rebounds to open the season. Defensively, Alicia Bates is the Lions' steals leader, collecting a team-leading nine steals, and Aalexuz Bourne leads the team in blocks, recording the Lions' sole block vs. Fort Lauderdale. SERIES HISTORY Tuesday will mark the 22nd all-time meeting between Florida Atlantic and Florida Memorial. The Owls hold a 20-1 all-time lead against the Lions and have won the last 14 matchups between the two programs. In the last meeting between the two squads, the Owls captured a 71-63 win on Dec. 7, 2021, at Eleanor R. Baldwin Arena in Boca Raton. SEASON PREVIEW UP NEXT Following Tuesday's contest, the Owls will open a three-game road stretch, beginning with a trip to Kennesaw, Georgia, on Saturday, Nov. 8, to face off against the Kennesaw State Owls. Tipoff is scheduled for 7 p.m. ET inside the KSU Convocation Center and on ESPN+. FOLLOW THE OWLS To stay up to date with everything Florida Atlantic women's basketball, follow @FAUWBB_Hoops on X and @FAUWBB on Instagram, or like Florida Atlantic Women's Basketball on Facebook.

headline: Zettl Earns Final Weekly Honorable Mention
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì Florida Atlantic men's soccer senior Sebastian Zettl has been named as an American Conference Weekly Honorable Mention for the final week of the regular season. Zettl returned from injury on Wednesday against USF and made an immediate impact in just 24 minutes of second half action. The Austrian delivered the free kick that was redirected home by Aboubacar Traore to tie the game 3-3. With 15 seconds left in the match, he connected on a shot from outside the box that beat the keeper and gave the Owls a dramatic 4-3 victory. The Owls drew with Tulsa 0-0 on Sunday night to claim a share of the American Conference regular season title. They will face either USF or Tulsa in the semifinals on Wednesday, November 12, at 3:30 p.m. in Charlotte, N.C. FOLLOW US For complete coverage of FAU men's soccer, follow us on X and Instagram (@FAUMSoccer).

headline: Owls to Debut Throwback Helmet on Homecoming
content: BOCA RATON, Fla. ‚Äì The 25th season anniversary celebration continues for Florida Atlantic football when the Owls play host to the Tulsa Golden Hurricane on Homecoming Weekend at Flagler Credit Union Stadium. The game is set for Saturday at 3 p.m. on ESPN+ with the Owls returning to their 2001 roots by donning the original classic white helmet, fronted with a red facemask and block "FAU" logo on the sides. Join the Owls and roll it back with your best vintage gear, which is on sale at the FAU Campus Store or online at ShopFAUSports.com. Mini replica throwback helmets will be on sale later this week. More than 1,000 players have represented the Owls since the program's inception in 2001, competing in nearly 300 games. FAU has won three conference titles and three bowls games in that same span.
